Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Impairment \Im*pair"ment\, n. [OE. enpeirement, OF. empirement.] The state, act, or process of being impaired; injury. ``The impairment of my health.'' --Dryden. [1913 Webster]

impairment n 1: the occurrence of a change for the worse [syn: {damage}, {harm}] 2: a symptom of reduced quality or strength [syn: {deterioration}] 3: the condition of being unable to perform as a consequence of physical or mental unfitness; "reading disability"; "hearing impairment" [syn: {disability}, {disablement}, {handicap}] 4: damage that results in a reduction of strength or quality 5: the act of making something futile and useless (as by routine) [syn: {stultification}, {constipation}, {deadening}]
